screen_desc: The screenshot shows a mobile phone's app store search page. The search bar at the top displays "Search for apps & games." Below the search bar, there are three search suggestions: "microsoft authenticator app," "booking.com hotels and more," and "indeed job search app." The screen also includes a microphone icon on the right, indicating the option to use voice search.
action_think: The user wants to open the Paramount+ app and go to the login screen. No app is visible on the current screen. The app may not be installed or may not be the first app in the list, so I will need to search for it.
action_plan: Scroll down the search suggestions to find the Paramount+ app.
If the app is not found, use the search bar to type 'Paramount+ | Peak Streaming' and submit the search.
If the app is found, click on it to install if not already installed and open the app.
Once the app is open, click on the login button.
action_desc: Scroll down the list of search suggestions to find the Paramount+ app.
action_result: The user has typed in the content "Paramount+ " in the search bar. This action is necessary to search for the "Paramount+ | Peak Streaming" app on the Google Play Store. However, this action alone is not sufficient to open the app or go to the login screen. The user will need to search for the app, install it, and then open the app to proceed to the login screen.
prev_action_result: The last action of clicking on the search bar with the text prompt "Search for apps & games" has redirected the user to the app store where they can search for and install the desired app. This action is a necessary step towards meeting the user's request to open and log into the "Paramount+ | Peak Streaming" app. However, the app is not visible in the current screenshot, which means that the user may need to scroll or search for it within the app store.
